topic.title: Button Form Control
topic.shortdesc: The oxy_button built-in form control is used for graphical user interface objects that invoke a custom Author mode action (defined in the associated Document Type) referencing it by its ID, or directly in the CSS.

body.p: The oxy_button form control supports the following properties: oxy_button(action, oxy_action( name, 'Insert', description, 'Insert an element after the current one', icon, url('insert.png'), operation, 'InsertFragmentOperation', arg-fragment, '${caret}', arg-insertLocation, '.', arg-insertPosition, 'After' ))You can also create a button form control directly from an oxy_action function. oxy_button( actionContext, caret, actions, oxy_action_list( oxy_action( name, 'SB', description, 'Surround fragment with multiple tags b -> i', operation, 'SurroundWithFragmentOperation', arg-fragment, '' ), oxy_action( name, 'SI', operation, 'SurroundWithFragmentOperation', arg-fragment, '' ) ) ) When using the oxy_action_list function, the name and description of the first defined action will be what is displayed for the button. A code template is available to make it easy to add the oxy_action_list function. p:before { content: oxy_button(hoverPseudoclassName, 'showBorder') } p:showBorder { border: 1px solid red; }
body.note: To insert a sample of the oxy_button form control in a CSS file (or LESS file), invoke the Content Completion Assistant by pressing and select the oxy_button code template. Also, an oxy_button_in_place_action code template is available that inserts an oxy_button function that includes an action parameter.
